snippet: Even as it wrestles with $18 billion in debt, the city has been charged more than $19.1 million by the firms and individuals hired to sort through the bankruptcy.
abstract: Detroit has already been billed more than $19.1 million by firms hired to sort through its bankruptcy, even as city wrestles with $18 billion in debt that has overwhelmed it; that does not include more costs that the city is expected to bear for support staff for its state-appointed emergency manager, and for another set of lawyers and consultants to represent city retirees.
lead_paragraph: Even as it wrestles with $18 billion in debt, the city has been charged more than $19.1 million by the firms and individuals hired to sort through the bankruptcy.

headline.main: Billions in Debt, Detroit Faces Millions in Bills for Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: Billions in Debt, Detroit Faces Millions in Bills for Bankruptcy

keywords.value: New Energy to Reinvent and Diversify (NERD)
